H0.text: Reptile is the class of animals that includes cold‑blooded vertebrates with smooth skin.

H1.text: Fish are a class of animals that are cold‑blooded vertebrates with smooth skin.

H2.text: Amphibian is the class of cold‑blooded vertebrates that have smooth skin.

H3.text: Mammal is the class of animals to which a cold‑blooded vertebrate with smooth skin belongs.

A4.text: Modern non-avian reptiles exhibit some form of cold-bloodedness (i.e. some mix of poikilothermy, ectothermy, and bradymetabolism)

A5.text: Reptilian skin is covered in a horny epidermis... Exposed parts of reptiles are protected by scales or scutes

A6.text: Most fish are cold-blooded, their body temperature varying with the surrounding water

A7.text: Fish have skin covered with scales
